reviewText: A couple years ago, when I first began the whole at-home exercise thing, I picked this title up from Walmart. Fast forward a few years later, and I still am a loyal Firm customer!This 40-minute workout is probably not ultra- challenging to anyone who has become used to high-energy, high-impact cardio.  However, if you like to shimmy your shoulders and pop your hips a little bit, I think you'll find it a fun workout regardless of its level of difficulty. It consists of a 5-minute warm-up, 30 minutes of steady-state dance cardio and a 5-minute cool-down.As I already stated, this was one of my first ever workout DVDs. In fact, it was probably the first dance DVD that I owned in which heart rate and fat-burning were the primary aim, instead of dance instruction first. So when I gave this a go initially, it kicked my rear and introduced me to REAL fitness!I recently pulled this one out again for a retro workout, and now it's kind of hard to imagine there ever having been a point when I could barely finish this! My strength and stamina have come a long way I guess. But a before-and-after experience was great for seeing how a beginner would do with this workout as opposed to how an intermediate/advanced would feel towards it.As stated before, CDSD is 40 minutes long in total. The aerobics portion is divided (though not chaptered, as it will only play in one complete 40 min. session) into 10 minutes of "club"dancing (you can decide if you would do these moves in a club!) , 10 minutes of Latin (you know, cha-chas, mambos, shoulder shakes) and 10 minutes of disco-style dancing (think Saturday Night Fever...that either scares you or makes you smile!). The choreography is done in an add-on style, so there is a lot of taking it from the top and then adding one more move until you have a flowing series.Personally, I like dance cardio, so I own a few of them. That being said, this was probably one of the better ones.  The moves are reasonably modern (excluding disco!) and not as unbelievably corny and cheesy as many of Denise Austin's dance videos, for example (no offense to Ms. Austin; I enjoy most of her workouts). And neither are they soo cutting edge and Janet Jackson-worthy that you literally will have to stop the DVD and rewind it several times, thus damaging its value as a workout (Lisa Nunziella!!). If someone was watching me, I wouldn't be all that embarrassed (at least not during the Club or Latin parts...)!The music is just okay, not the best. In fact, in parts, the music doesn't seem to fit the style of dance being done. For example, during the Latin segment (which is nonetheless my favorite!), the music suddenly morphs from a somewhat Latin-ish style to a techno thumping beat. Huh? Oh well, I have fun anyway.Another small caveat: Some of the moves aren't the greatest on carpet, such as the butterfly (though I like this move b/c it reminds me of house parties in junior high!). But they're not really that numerous to be a huge issue. I'm sure you can make it work!Like most dance-inspired workouts, you get out of it what you put into it. If you REALLY shake your shoulders when you're supposed to, and REALLY get into that mambo, you will get your heart rate up. Now that being said, intermediate/advanced exercisers will probably come out having shed some slight sweat that will quickly evaporate.  Beginners will get the most out of this.  This workout is pretty low-impact, with some light jumping in the club segment as well as the very end of the disco segment.If you would like to see a clip of this (I recommend that you do), you can check it out at The Firm's official site under "Store."
summary: GREAT for Beginners...Good for Booty Shakers...!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Though this isn't an amazing workout, it's really not THAT bad.  Maybe it's not great cardio and it doesn't use weights or anything, but it's still fun to do and does get you moving and should get your heart rate up at least a little.This would be good for those who can only do low impact or those who are having a rest day between workouts, etc.I was happy that the dancing was slow enough that I could keep up.  And most of the dance moves are easy enough to do and remember.  A lot of dance workouts are so confusing and move way too fast to keep up with.  My favorite section was the disco.  A lot of the moves are cheesy, but why not have fun with it?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this DVD in the mail yesterday and couldn't wait to add it to my exercise routine for a change of pace.It is FUN. Who cares if the moves are a little dorky? I am less interested in learning to dance like a pro and more interested in getting my body moving in new and sweat-inducing ways. The moves are mostly easy to follow but still challenging enough to get the heart rate up. Remember, you aren't going to do it perfectly the first time. I've never cared about dancing before but on my first try the moves became fluid enough that they didn't feel jerky.I can understand why a more advanced exerciser would feel a little bored with it, but if you are just beginning or intermediate (I am barely intermediate) you will burn calories with this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved this cardio dance dvd.  Allie Delrio is my favorite Firm master instructor.  She is so full of energy and fun to watch!  This dvd is low/mod intensity, but very fun.  It's a good one to add to any collection to keep the body from getting into a funk.  I love it.  You'll find yourself laughing at yourself in some of the workouts.  You don't have to be a dance superstar to be able to do this dvd.  The moves are very basic, but really fun.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am not good with dancing, but I ordered this to give it a try. I really like it, but it is cardio for sure...hard to keep up to but a good workout

reviewText: My mom bought this Dance Workout because she wanted me and her to start exercising more. When and mom 1st did this dance workout it was hard at 1st to keep up with the dance speed pace of how fast they were doing it. When I started doing this alot more I got use to the dance speed pace is how fast they were doing it. I do this Firm Dance Workout alot more and I have fun and enjoy doing it and I always have a smile on my face when I'm doing it even though my mom was the 1 that bought it I do it more than her. I like the dance moves is the disco,the salsa, and the butterfly. The Salsa is my favorite. I really Thank my mom for buying The Firm Dance Cardio Slimdown Alot!!!!

reviewText: Allie is my favorite instructor and I was disappointed the Latin section was on another disc, cardio dance party. If I'm paying for a new DVD with a new name and description, I expect a new workout. The 70s section was fun and different.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've tried this DVD a couple of times and just am not enjoying it.I think part of it is, as a couple of other reviewers have noted, that many of the moves are hard to do on a carpeted floor. The moves are much more fluid on a hardwood floor.And many of the moves, imo, are just too silly for me; I think I just like a workout that's more functional and this one was not.  I wish I could return it.btw, I love Allie del Pointer as an instructor and bought the DVD based on other workouts of hers; her timing is perfect and she's enthusiastic. It's not you, Allie, it's me!  : )
Title: N/A

reviewText: Been a Firm Believer for 23 years now and love almost all of their vids and trust the quality of their methods.  Dance vids are some of my least fav but overall good workout.  Allie is my fav instructor so that is a bonus.  :)

reviewText: Thank goodness I only rented this video.  It was the worst Firm workout I've ever done.  It did NOT get my heart rate up at all.  It was a waste of time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD with the same low expectations of it that I have had since 2002 when the Firm was sold by Anna Benson (the original designer of the workouts).  The post 2002 DVDs/videos by the Firm do not have the same feel as the older ones do, and are not as hard.  I do like Allie Del Rio Pointer and that is why I bought it, also I had never bought a dance excersize DVD before.The music is terrible and frequently does not fit the dance "moves" Allie instructs us to do.  There are also some moves that do not work well on carpedted floors (the "butterfly" move in the warmup is what I am referring to).  It does not get my heart up very much.  However....I like this workout!  On days when I do not want to work out I reach for this DVD.  It is over quickly and still gets my heart up a little, and I don't have to go outside in poor weather (when we have it here).  I feel like an idiot for enjoying this workout but I do.  It is a keeper for me, although I agree with the other reviewer who stated that you will not be doing  ANY of the moves in this workout in a club.Allie is not going to win any dance contests with the moves in this DVD!
summary: The other reviews are on target..yet I keep REACHING for this one!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a big fan of the Firm. I like some workouts more than others, sure ... however I can find very little I like about Cardio Dance at all. I workout 4 to 5 times per week with Firm workouts, and usually break a sweat and feel as though I've gotten a good workout when all is said and done. This isn't the case with Cardio Dance. I barely break a sweat. It's very low-impact, and doesn't get my heart rate up to its desire level for fat burning. I think I'd get a better workout dancing around the house.What makes Cardio Dance unbearable is Allie's lack of cueing (which is nearly non-existent in this workout), and the lack of rhythm within the workout moves. The dance moves are supposed to be fun, but the manner in which the moves are combined makes them feel awkward, and forced. They don't flow and are therefore difficult to commit to memory. In addition to this, the dance moves incorporate a large amount of swiveling and dragging one's feet on the ground. This might be fine for someone working out on a smooth, hardwood floor, but for those who happen to work out on carpet or on a matt (as is the case with most home exercisers), this is hard on the knees. I'd rather jump than slide my feet around, but this workout has no jumping, just sliding, snapping and bouncing. Boring.I wouldn't recommend this workout to anyone. If you want to have fun working out try Cardio Fusion instead, and leave this one for the grannies with strong knees.
summary: So disappointed ... where is the rhythm? Where is the fun?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the first time I have ever purchased a "The Firm" dvd.  I was really disappointed in this one.  Many of the moves are not properly explained.  Some movements target only one side of the body and they don't bother having you switch sides to work the other.  (really obvious in the salsa style section) It took a few times of doing to get all the moves right, but even after that it barely raises the heart rate.  The warm up leaves much to be desired. The cool down continues the "dance" movements but at a "slower" rate and stretching the neck for one second on each side and the inner thigh for one second here and those are not enough to even make you realize that you are stretching. I am used to Denise Austin workouts, that are half the length but you actually feel like you did something when you are done.  Not so with this "workout" at all.  Definately a waste for someone who isn't just starting out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This might not get your heart rate up as you'd like, however, with some creativity and extra effort you can increase the intensity of the moves. I enjoyed the instructor because she wasn't annoying and her cues are excellent. Many of the moves are cheesy, and I wouldn't be caught dead trying any of them in a club, but it's pretty fun to do with the blinds closed in the comforts of home. There is no toning involved and the workout from start to finish is just under 40 minutes, so it's good for light workout days.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is such a great routine and was easy to follow and get completely into and rock out. It's well-structured, the warm-up and cool-down segments are creative and excellent, and the dance choreography portions are thrillingly doable and allow for lots of personal expression. Allie DelRio is one of my favorite Firm instructors and I do her workouts with the step and weights and this floor routine is a wonderful break from the other routine while loosening your muscles and giving a great aerobic workout. Excellent Job!!!
summary: Super Fun and Easy to Get Into!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the more fun workouts by The Firm - Allie is one of my favorite instructors and she gives very clear instructions. Initially I thought I wasn't getting much of a good workout, but after doing it a couple of times and getting more familiar with the moves, I could put more effort into it and get a really good, FUN workout! Definitely recommend this one!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok, this is set on a stage with Allie & 4 backup women all in great shape. Allie is great, good cues, sweet, she tries SOO much, but she dances like she's rushing to get it over with or being rushed, so there's no style or enjoyment. The moves & her dancing is what is lacking. The music is bad mixed that tries to steal some parts from popular music w/o getting sued, but sounds too boring.The warm up tries to use head rolls, shoulder rolls & bad hip rolls as a warmup that is too fast. You don't get any stretch or benefit from it.All the moves are VERY cheesy, there's only a few cha-chas, grapevines, "hitchhiker" & etc. that are somewhat decent, but the rest are, sorry to say LAUGH OUT LOUD bad. Even the latin cha-chas had NO hip use from any of them. They all look like cheerleader tryout rejects. Some of the moves are exactly like Starday Night John Travolata pointing, shifting an imaginary towel against your butt, box step, the jerk, locomotion, etc. If anyone did this on a dance floor everyone would be on the floor crying in laughter. This is the first dance workout of over like 50 I've seen that I was dying & couldn't even watch.The last 5 min cool down has better slower toning, stretching & finally a little grace.The only good I can say is the production quality, the music CAN be worse, but not by much, Allie does try her best & has good cues. This is only for people with no dance ability & only for very light days.Video Clips: collagevideo com & totalfitnessdvds com
summary: Cheeesy & Disco Dance for light days/those who can't dance
Title: N/A
